titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 43, PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE BY SECRETARY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES; PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 69, PROVIDING...

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 43, PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF FINAL RULE BY SECRETARY OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES; PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 69, PROVIDING...; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 27

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients and Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska''_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 123, providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 43) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 69) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 94, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 93.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients and Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska''_Rule for Consideration
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to H. Res. 123, providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 43) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule submitted by Secretary of Health and Human Services relating to compliance with title X requirements by project recipients in selecting subrecipients; providing for consideration of the joint resolution (H.J. Res. 69) providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the final rule of the Department of the Interior relating to ``Non-Subsistence Take of Wildlife, and Public Participation and Closure Procedures, on National Wildlife Refuges in Alaska'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 188 nays, Roll No. 94, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 233 yeas to 190 nays, Roll No. 93.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by qualified State political subdivisions for non-governmental employees
Disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by qualified State political subdivisions for non-governmental employees
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 67, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by qualified State political subdivisions for non-governmental employees, by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 95.

The House passed H.J. Res. 67, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of Labor relating to savings arrangements established by qualified State political subdivisions for non-governmental employees, by a yea-and-nay vote of 234 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 95.

congVote.result: The joint resolution (H.J. Res. 40) was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Social Security Administration Rule Relating to Implementation of the NICS Improvement Amendments Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>: By 57 yeas to 43 nays (Vote No. 66), Senate passed H.J. Res. 40, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Social Security Administration relating to Implementation of the NICS Improvement Amendments Act of 2007.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Mick Mulvaney, of South Carolina, to be Director of the Office of Management and Budget.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 52 yeas to 48 nays (Vote No. 67), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
